author: Wojciech Zylm
title: Poland Marks 25 Years in NATO: A Pillar of Strength on Eastern Flank
text:
As Poland commemorates a quarter-century of NATO membership, General Wiesław Kukuła, the Chief of the General Staff of the Polish Armed Forces, has shed light on the nation's pivotal role and its journey within the Alliance. Celebrating this milestone, Kukuła emphasizes Poland's evolution into a key player, especially as a leader on NATO's eastern flank, showcasing the country's significant contributions and strategic position.
Advertisment Poland's Transformation and Leadership within NATO Over the last 25 years, Poland has experienced a remarkable transformation, redefining its stance and influence within NATO. "Today, NATO is us," General Kukuła remarked, highlighting Poland's proactive approach in bolstering the Armed Forces and its active engagement in NATO missions and planning. This leadership has not only made Poland a regional beacon but has also amplified its voice within the Alliance. Amidst various political challenges, the General views NATO as the prime mechanism to counter contemporary security threats, with Poland setting a benchmark for anticipation and response strategies.
Envisioning Synergy Between NATO and the EU Advertisment Addressing the notion of a unified European Armed Forces, General Kukuła expressed skepticism regarding its current feasibility. However, he underscored the potential in fostering a synergistic relationship between NATO and the European Union (EU), especially in enhancing economic and industrial security processes. Advocating for an EU Commissioner for Defense, Kukuła believes such a position could significantly improve the Union’s defense policy management, ensuring better synchronization with NATO's goals. This synergy is further exemplified by the dual membership of 23 countries in both the EU and NATO, with Poland actively contributing to the EU's defense initiatives.
Sweden's NATO Membership: Strengthening the Baltic Defense With NATO's recent addition of Sweden as its 32nd member, General Kukuła views this expansion as a strategic boon for the Baltic region. He commended Sweden's well-prepared defense mechanisms and formidable armed forces, asserting that Sweden's inclusion not only bolsters its own security but also significantly strengthens the Alliance. This development is seen as completing a strategic puzzle in the Baltic, enhancing the collective defense and security architecture of the region.
As Poland celebrates this significant anniversary, it not only reflects on its past achievements within NATO but also looks forward to shaping the future of the Alliance. General Kukuła's insights reveal a country deeply integrated and influential in NATO, ready to lead and innovate in response to evolving security challenges. This milestone underscores Poland's unwavering commitment to collective defense and epitomizes its strategic importance within the Euro-Atlantic security framework.

organizations.name: general staff of the polish armed forces

author: Leigh Morgan
title: Isolated severe storms possible in Alabama Friday - al.com
text: Friday promises to be another hot one across Alabama, and heat advisories will be in effect for much of the state. But parts of Alabama may have to deal with severe storms as well. NOAA’s Storm Prediction Center is forecasting a Level 1 out of 5 (marginal) risk for severe weather for parts of north and central Alabama today. A Level 1 risk means that isolated severe storms will be possible. The National Weather Service thinks that the strongest storms could bring damaging wind gusts capable of toppling trees and power lines. Tornadoes and hail are not expected. A front approaching Alabama from the north could help to kick off those isolated storms this afternoon, according to the weather service. The front could slowly move southeastward through the night and into Saturday, and will bring greater rain chances to parts of southern Alabama for the first day of the weekend. Today will still be very hot statewide, however. Air temperatures are forecast to again climb into the mid- to even upper 90s by this afternoon, and those combined with higher humidity levels have prompted another round of heat advisories for all but eastern Alabama today. Here is a look at Friday’s heat advisories for Alabama: NORTH ALABAMA * Heat advisory for all of north Alabama except DeKalb and Jackson counties from 11 a.m. until 7 p.m. Friday. The National Weather Service in Huntsville said the heat index could reach 109 degrees in the rest of north Alabama this afternoon. CENTRAL ALABAMA * https://forecast.weather.gov/wwamap/wwatxtget.php?cwa=BMX&wwa=heat%20advisory until 9 p.m. Friday for all of central Alabama except for Chambers, Cherokee, Cleburne, Calhoun, Clay, Etowah and Randolph counties. The National Weather Service in Birmingham said the heat index could climb as high as 107 for parts of central Alabama this afternoon. SOUTH ALABAMA * https://forecast.weather.gov/wwamap/wwatxtget.php?cwa=MOB&wwa=heat%20advisory from 10 a.m. until 7 p.m. Friday for all of southwest Alabama. The National Weather Service in Mobile said the heat index could hit 112 degrees in that region today. * https://forecast.weather.gov/wwamap/wwatxtget.php?cwa=TAE&wwa=heat%20advisory from 10 a.m. until 7 p.m. CDT for southeast Alabama. The National Weather Service in Tallahassee, Fla., said the heat index could get as high as 110 degrees today in that region.

author: T.D.
title: Le Portugal bat la Croatie grâce à Ronaldo, l’Espagne tenue en échec par la Serbie
text: Le Portugal bat la Croatie grâce à Ronaldo, l’Espagne tenue en échec par la Serbie Ligue des NationsL’édition 2024-2025 de la Ligue des Nations s’ouvrait ce jeudi soir avec notamment plusieurs rencontres de la Ligue A. Dans le groupe 1, le Portugal de Roberto Martinez, qui accueillait la Croatie, s’est imposé 2-1. Diego Dalot a rapidement ouvert la marque (7e, 1-0) avant que Cristiano Ronaldo ne double la mise (34e, 2-0). Dalot a marqué contre son camp pour relancer la Croatie (41e, 2-1), en vain. Dans le même groupe, la Pologne a battu l’Écosse 2-3. Sebastian Szymanski a marqué après seulement 8 minutes (0-1). Robert Lewandowski a creusé l’écart sur penalty en fin de première période (44e, 0-2), mais l’Écosse est ensuite revenue grâce à Billy Gilmour (46e, 1-2) et Scott McTominay (76e, 2-2). Nicola Zalewski a finalement offert la victoire aux Polonais avec un but sur penalty à la 90e+7 (2-3). Dans le groupe 4, le champion d’Europe en titre, l’Espagne, débutait son tournoi avec un déplacement en Serbie. La rencontre s’est terminée sur un score vierge (0-0). Les autres nations de ce groupe, le Danemark et la Suisse, s’affrontaient en même temps. Les Danois se sont imposés 2-0 avec des buts tombés en fin de match via Patrick Dorgu (82e, 1-0) et Pierre-Émile Hojbjerg (90e, 2-0). Nico Elvedi (52e) et Granit Xhaka (87e) ont été exclus du côté de la Suisse. Le joueur d’Anderlecht, Kasper Dolberg, était titulaire en pointe de l’attaque danoise tandis qu’Andreas Skov Olsen (Club Bruges) a entamé la rencontre sur le banc et est monté à la 81e. En Ligue C, dans le groupe 3, le Luxembourg d’Anthony Moris (Union Saint-Gilloise) se déplaçait en Irlande du Nord où Isaac Price (Standard) était également titulaire. Les Britanniques l’ont emporté avec des buts inscrits coup sur coup par les défenseurs Paddy McNair (11e, 1-0) et Daniel Ballard (16e, 2-0). LIRE AUSSI Gratis onbeperkt toegang tot Showbytes? Dat kan!Log in of maak een account aan en mis niks meer van de sterren. Aussi dans l'actualité - Premier League Un nouveau triplé pour Haaland et le neuf sur neuf pour City - Guide-epargne.be Voici comment vous pouvez faire la distinction entre les “bonnes” et “mauvaises” dettesIl se peut que vous croyiez que toutes vos dettes soient “mauvaises" finalement ou qu’elles soient moins favorables qu’un financement sur fonds propres? Toutefois, ceci n’est pas correct. Il y a également de “bonnes” dettes. Et vous pouvez transformer vos ‘mauvaises’ dettes en ‘bonnes’ dettes. Ci-dessous, Guide-epargne.be vous fournit des explications à ce sujet. - Serie A Un but et une victoire à l’arraché: Romelu Lukaku déjà à la fête avec le NapoliDeux jours après l’officialisation de son transfert, Romelu Lukaku a déjà joué... et marqué avec le Napoli. Monté à l’heure de jeu alors que son équipe était menée 0-1 par Parme, le néo-Napolitain a égalisé à la 92e minute et c’est Anguissa qui a inscrit le but de la victoire du Napoli cinq minutes plus tard (2-1). - City et un programme très costaud pour Bruges en C1: découvrez les adversaires du ClubBruges voulait des affiches de gala, il est servi. Le Club ira défier City à l’Etihad Stadium et s’offre un autre déplacement mythique à San Siro pour y défier le Milan AC. A la maison, ce n’est pas mal non plus avec la réception de Dortmund et de la Juventus. Le Sporting Lisbonne, Aston Villa, Sturm Graz et le Celtic complètent le programme des Blauw en Zwart. - Pro League Felice Mazzu reprend du service et signe à Saint-TrondFelice Mazzu est de retour en Pro League! Un peu moins de six mois après avoir quitté le Sporting de Charleroi, le coach carolo s’est engagé à Saint-Trond. Il succède à Christian Lattanzio, remercié en début de semaine, sur le banc du STVV. - Monenergie.be Tarifs énergétiques de septembre: une hausse de 83 euros par an - Monenergie L’ombudsman plaide pour un contrôle renforcé des tarifs énergétiquesL’ombudsman fédéral pour l’énergie appelle à la mise en place d’un mécanisme de filet de sécurité visant à mieux protéger les consommateurs. Ce dispositif impliquerait que la Commission de régulation de l’électricité et du gaz (CREG) examine et approuve tous les nouveaux contrats. Eric Houtman explique à Monenergie.be que la transparence sur les différences entre les formules tarifaires variables, les frais fixes et les coûts d’abonnement est essentielle pour restaurer la confiance des consommateurs. - Jackpot pour Genk: Bilal El Khannouss rejoint Leicester City pour 25 millions d’eurosBilal El Khannouss, le milieu de terrain marocain de 20 ans rejoint la Premier League. Leicester City a confirmé officiellement son arrivée. Le Racing Genk recevra un montant de 25 millions d’euros, bonus inclus, égalant ainsi le record du transfert le plus cher du club. El Khannouss a signé un contrat de quatre ans avec Leicester City.

author: Virgil Villanueva
title: Qualtrics, Dow succeed in CX digital transformation venture - Outsource Accelerator
text: Qualtrics, Dow succeed in CX digital transformation venture UTAH & WASHINGTON, UNITED STATES — Software provider Qualtrics has successfully [launched](https://www.qualtrics.com/news/qualtrics-insights-help-dow-unlock-300-million-in-value-through-digital-and-cx-transformation/) a digital transformation that raised the [customer experience (CX)](https://www.outsourceaccelerator.com/articles/customer-experience-optimization/?utm_source=%28referral%29&utm_medium=news+article&utm_campaign=NPR+Referral) for the materials science firm Dow. Dow used several of Qualtrics’ advanced tools, such as the Qualtrics Digital CX and the Qualtrics XM Institute CX Maturity assessment, to identify and understand the unique needs of its customers. They then compared these insights with various operational and financial metrics and used them to iron out key operational functions in shipment visibility and tracking, supply, order upgrade placements, and demand and inventory management. Dow combined these insights with its visualization and predictive modeling platforms, which enabled their customers to craft efficient production chains. According to the two firms, their partnership resulted in a 450% increase in repeat visitors to Dow’s digital commerce platform, an increase in new leads generated via digital engagement from 5% to 65%, and an over 200% increase in digital orders. All in all, it generated $300 million in value. Riccardo Porta, the global director for CX at Dow said: “From the early days of our journey, Qualtrics solutions have allowed us to rationalize and monetize our CX disciplines to unlock new value for our customers and for Dow.” Sachin Goregaoker, Chief Product Officer of Qualtrics XM for Digital Frontlines, expressed pride in helping Dow realize its goal with a data-led enterprise-wide CX strategy: “In the experience economy, the brands that win and continue to stay at the forefront are those that listen to their customers and improve processes across every critical interaction.”
